Overview.Phrase: Adding a package to Visual Studio using C++.

Introduction.Summary: This reference sample demonstrates how to create a VSPackage in C++. It demonstrates how to implement a basic VSPackage that displays its product information in the Visual Studio Help About dialog.
Introduction.Goal: Advertising the VSPackage in Help About

GettingStarted.Paragraph: The sample provides the BasicPackage class to demonstrate the implementation of a basic VSPackage using the Visual Studio Library.
Please see BasicPackage.h for an in-depth description of how the class is implemented.

BuildingTheSample.Step: Press F5 to build the sample, register it in the experimental instance, and launch Visual Studio from the experimental instance.

SampleTask.Description: To show the package information in the About dialog...
SampleTask.Step: Open a Visual Studio Command Prompt and type: devenv /rootsuffix Exp

FunctionalTests.Test: Sample builds without any errors and warnings in both Debug and Release configurations
Registration is appropriately entered under the experimental instance when regit.exe is used for registration.

After registration in the experimental Visual Studio hive by calling 'Devenv /rootsuffix Exp /setup', the package information is correctly displayed in the Help About dialog when 'Devenv /rootsuffix Exp /NoVsip' is called.
